ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 3 hours for weekly reading; 4 hours for homework assignments
15-20 hours
About eight.
4 to 6 hours.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I found this course to be extremely interesting. The structure of the course helped me build my understanding of the course material and then apply it to a real life situation. At times, lectures felt a little rushed, but overall, I really enjoyed this course and found the assignments, including 3 labs, to be very helpful and comprehensive.
This is a great survey course. It is structured well, beginning with a review of theory followed by specific case studies and methods. There should be more courses on this topic!

Very interesting course. The material was fascinating. However, its main weakness was that lectures were dry at times and it could have been more interactive. The class was small enough that it could have been directed more as a seminar.
I really enjoyed taking this course with Maria. She is a great instructor/lecturer and introduces a lot of interesting topics tying together ecology and epidemiology.

Excellent course is an introduction to for extension of ecoepidemiology. Combination of lecture material and labs were extremely helpful. Lecture format was straightforward and slides were clear. Reading material support of and showed practical application of principles learned in class.

Strengths:i) A multi-disciplinary approach. (ecology, epidemiology, vector borne diseases, geo-spatial analysis)ii) A diverse student group. (public health, forestry)iii) A peer-reviewed grant proposal.Weaknesses:i) Some concepts can be repetitive depending upon your background.
Lots of different topics covered, but perhaps meeting with students and choosing areas of focus for the duration of the course could make it more enjoyable.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Maria Diuk-Wasser  Knowledgeable and engaging, great at presenting cross-disciplinary ideas
Instructor: Maria Diuk-Wasser  Dr. Diuk-Wasser was extremely approachable and helpful.

Instructor: Maria Diuk-Wasser  Maria is wonderful. She's a great lecturer and responds well to students. She is patient and understanding and is always available if you want to discuss something more. Definitely take a course with her if you can!
Instructor: Maria Diuk-Wasser  Professor Diuk-Wasser was extremely helpful and receptive. She was a ton of help in writing the research paper, and was really always there to help the students.

Instructor: Maria Diuk-Wasser  Excellent instructor. Clear lecture material and emphasized the appropriate themes. She has significant experience in the field to answer practical questions. Very willing to be available to help with projects. Flexible with assignments when necessary.

Instructor: Maria Diuk-Wasser  Great lecturer, very knowledgeable and engaging. Readings were sometimes dense but were used well in the curriculum. Homework assignments were decent, but greater collaboration between the groups and the professor may improve the quality of presentations and assignments from each SLD.

Instructor: Maria Diuk-Wasser  She is wonderful and very understanding in terms of extending due dates, providing more information, etc. Lectures are a little fast paced and mostly powerpoint based, which can get monotonous.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Instructor: Marina Antillon  helpful and friendly!
Instructor: Marina Antillon  Marina was extremely approachable and helpful.
Instructor: Marina Antillon  She helped a lot with the labs and was always there when we needed her.
Instructor: Marina Antillon  Marina is an angel. She is the most patient, dedicated, and wonderful TA of all time.

Instructor: Marina Antillon  Excellent teaching assistant. Very helpful and went out of her way to be available for additional instruction for difficult or new material. Very supportive regarding special problems. Overall superior.

Instructor: Marina Antillon  Great job taking over for professor when she was not present. Printed notes were also appreciated. Labs could be a little more polished in the future, as some parts were skipped over.
Instructor: Marina Antillon  So helpful! Some of the labs were a little unclear but she went above and beyond to be available outside of class to provide help.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend this course. I learned a great deal from this course and the labs.
Highly recommend.

Yes take it! If you are at all interested in epidemiology, this is a great introduction to it that will change the way you think. The coursework is not too heavy, a couple homework assignments, a student led discussion, 3 labs, a midterm and a final project. The final project is really a great learning experience.

Excellent course for the student interested in this particular field. Some experience helpful but not necessary. Diverse assignments including midterm and final project helpful in highlighting major points that are central to this course.
This course provides a great look at the large intersectionbetween ecology and epidemiology. I would recommend the course to someone interested in global epidemiology or zoonotic disease.

If you are interested in vector borne disease, yes, definitely take this course! If not, you will not like this course and not learn enough public health skills that can be applied to other diseases. Builds on Infectious Diseases class nicely.
